object.name: blackberry.message.sms
object.comment: Provides static functions to send SMS messages
object.detail: Provides static functions to send and receiveSMS messages
object.example:
<script type="text/javascript">
  blackberry.message.sms.send("hello world", "987654321");

  var listener = function (msg, from, date) {
	alert(from+" "+msg+" "+date);
  }

  blackberry.message.sms.isListeningForMessage = true;
  blackberry.message.sms.addReceiveListener(listener);

  if (blackberry.message.sms.removeReceiveListener()){
	alert("Listener removed successfully.");
	blackberry.message.sms.isListeningForMessage = false;
  }
</script>

property.name: isListeningForMessage
property.comment: determine whether the message listeners are activated

func.name: send
func.comment: Static function to send out an SMS message

param.name: message
param.comment: The text that should be sent

param.name: address
param.comment: Address where the message should be delivered to.

func.name: addReceiveListener
func.comment: SMS listener to receive a message when it arrives

param.name: callback
param.comment: Callback function that is invoked when a new SMS message is received. Overwrites the previous callback. The parameters are: message, sender, and date.

func.name: removeReceiveListener
func.comment: Remove the registered listener. Return false if there is no listener
